Pull request successfully merged into master.

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

Does
```suggestion
@[simps!]
def submodule_torsionBy_orderIso (a : R) :
```
make the linter happier?

Sadly no.

I would have to state the LHS using `R ⧸ Ideal.span {a}` rather than `R ⧸ R ∙ a` to appease the linter. These are defeq but I much prefer the latter because of the notation, and besides all the adjacent lemmas use this spelling.

I think the right fix is probably to drop `simp` from `Ideal.submodule_span_eq` and make `Ideal.span` an `abbrev`.
Ok, thanks for debugging. Should we record this in an issue, or as a comment in this/that file?
Opinions might be divided so I'll start a thread on Zulip.
This is surprising... I would've expected that you would need to explicitly use something about `torsionBy` on this line.

This is the reverse direction (regarding an `R`-submodule as an `(R ⧸ R ∙ a)`-submodule) so this step is trivial.

Of course you're right that there must be something non-trivial somewhere!

IIUC, what's happening is that the forward direction uses `restrictScalarsEmbedding` which demands a `IsScalarTower R (R ⧸ R ∙ a) (torsionBy R M a)` instance. This is ultimately provided by the proof of [Module.IsTorsionBySet.isScalarTower](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Torsion.html#Module.IsTorsionBySet.isScalarTower) where indeed we see `Quotient.inductionOn'` invoked.
